Event.name: Being_employed
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Employee</fen> has a <fen>Position</fen> doing work in a particular <fen>Field</fen>, or doing work on a particular <fen>Task</fen>, for which an <fen>Employer</fen> gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to the <fen>Employee</fen>.
<ex> <fex name="Employee">Undocumented foreigners</fex> are <t>working</t> <fex name="Position">as building contractors</fex> <fex name="Employer">for Laing Builders</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Compensation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Compensation</fen> is the payment that the <fen>Employee</fen> receives for performing a <fen>Task</fen>.
<ex>Louise <t>works</t> as an engineer <fex name="Compens">for $1,000</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Employee
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform a <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Empee">My Mom</fex> <t>works</t> for the Michigan Department of Agriculture.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Employer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Employer</fen> gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.
<ex>My mom <t>works</t> <fex name="Emper">for an Eye Doctor</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which an <fen>Employee</fen> works for an <fen>Employer</fen>.
<ex> Last weekend, the commercial TV station Nova broadcast testimonies of young Czechs who have <t>worked</t> <fex name="Mnr">illegally</fex> for America's largest retailer, Wal-Mart.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place_of_employment
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place_of_employment</fen> of the <fen>Employee</fen>.
<ex>The undocumented foreigners were <t>working</t> <fex name="Place_of_employment">at the organic farm</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Position
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The label given to a particular type of employment.
<ex>Louise <t>works</t> <fex name="Posit">as an engineer</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an <fen>Employee</fen> is in employment.
<ex>He <t>waited</t> <t>tables</t> <fex name="Purp">to finance his education at St. Lawrence University, where he was a top-notch wrestler</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Task
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform the <fen>Task</fen> to recieve <fen>Compensation</fen> from the <fen>Employer</fen> . <ex>My dad <t>works</t> <fex name="Task">building houses.</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> period during which an <fen>Employee</fen> works for an <fen>Employer</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Time">From 2000-2001</fex>, Mr. Eckhardt <t>clerked</t> for The Honorable Jerry A. Funk, United States Bankruptcy Judge, Middle District of Florida.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Field
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Field</fen> in which one works.
<ex>Undocumented foreigners <t>work</t> <fex name="Field">in construction</fex> for years.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the amount of <fen>Time</fen> for which the <fen>Employee</fen> continues being employed.
<ex>She <t>worked</t> <fex name="Dur">for 10 years</fex> in private and hospital practice and 19 years in teaching and administration.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Rank
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Rank</fen> is the position in a hierarchy that an <fen>Employee</fen> occupies within the organization of the <fen>Employer</fen>.
<ex>Sue has the <fex name="Rank"> top</fex> <t>job</t> in the company.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Type
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Type</fen> of the profession.
<ex>He's harkening back to a time before Bush became president and he had a <fex name="Type">white collar</fex> <t>job</t> and wore a suit.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Contract_basis
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Contract_basis</fen> describes the conditions of employment with respect to permanency, hours per time period, or payment basis.
<ex>As much as possible, however, do not attempt to run a full-time business in addition to holding a <fex name="CB">full-time</fex> <t>job</t> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Employee</fen> works.
<ex>Most people <t>work</t> <fex name="pla">in the city</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE gives a description of the Being_employed event. </def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: work.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: do work, especially as one's job.

lexUnit.name: work.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: activity as a means of earning income.

lexUnit.name: employ.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state of being employed; employment.

lexUnit.name: wait tables.idio
lexUnit.definition: COD: act as a waiter or waitress

lexUnit.name: job.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a paid position of regular employment.

lexUnit.name: temp.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: no obj. work as a temp.

lexUnit.name: stint.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an allotted period of work.

lexUnit.name: subcontract.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: employ a firm or person outside one's company to do (work).

lexUnit.name: farm (out).v
lexUnit.definition: COD: send out or subcontract work to others

lexUnit.name: unemployment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state of being unemployed.

lexUnit.name: unemployed.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: without a paid job but available to work.

lexUnit.name: at.prep
lexUnit.definition: FN: employed by; with a position at (a large institution or significant company).
